intro: Deppea foliosa, commonly known as the hairy leaf deppea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Deppea foliosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
